text:
FATHE NOORI: One time I was
going to the grocery store

with my wife, and she
has hijab, which is her--
she cover her hair.

And we try to help a lady
because she had a lot of items
with her.
And she told us, we--

I don't need help
from terrorists.

And we just walk back and
said, it's OK, no problem.

I don't judge her because
that's what she heard.

SHADI MARTINI: Sometimes
it's always the person coming
into the you know, the airport.

Some airports are much more like
welcoming sometimes when there

is an incidence, you come, and
the way-- the aggressiveness

that some agents greet
you with sometimes

give you a tense moment of, or
feeling of not being welcomed.
But that's a temporary thing.
Then you brush it off.

ZUBAIR RUSHK: It's very
normal to hear someone,
go back to your country.

It's happened to
almost every week.

You will heard it from
someone and indirerctly

or, directly go back
where you come from.
